qas.question: Islamic World is another way to refer to what?
When speaking of religion, what does Ummah refer to?

answers.text: those who adhere to the teachings of Islam

qas.question: When speaking about culture, what does Ummah refer to?
Community, or Nation are direct translations of what word in reference to Islam?
World and group are the same as what Aribic word?
What civilization does Ummah refer to when used in a religious sense?
What teachings does Ummah refer to when used in a cultural sense?
What term refers to all countries where Muslims live?

context: The term <a0_0>Muslim world<a0_0/>, also known as Islamic world and the <a3_0><b4_0>Ummah<b4_0/><a3_0/> (Arabic: أمة‎, meaning "nation" or "community") has different meanings. In a religious sense, the Islamic Ummah refers to <a1_0>those who adhere to the <b6_0>teachings of Islam<b6_0/><a1_0/>, referred to as Muslims. In a cultural sense, the Muslim Ummah refers to <a2_0><b5_0>Islamic<b5_0/> civilization<a2_0/>, exclusive of non-Muslims living in that civilization. In a modern geopolitical sense, the term <b7_0>"Islamic Nation"<b7_0/> usually refers collectively to Muslim-majority countries, states, districts, or towns.
